Text: If you see this text tell James.
If the pirates make it through our warriors we are certainly doomed!
Notes: Peasants on main island of Dagger Wound before the pirate outpost is defeated

Text: Our thanks for defeating the pirates!  Now if you could only do something about the mountain of fire!
Notes: Peasants on main island of Dagger Wound after the pirate outpost is defeated (Questbit 6)

Text: There is no way back to the village of Blood Drop!  I have no way of knowing if my family lives or not!
Notes: Peasants on smaller islands before teleporters are fixed

Text: You came through the Portals of Stone?  They are working?  We can return to our families!
Notes: Peasants on smaller islands after teleporters are fixed (questbit 2)

Text: Argh!  Either get in the fight, or get out of our way!
Someone should clear out the caves that the dire wolves use for their lair.  If we had one less thing to worry about, things might get a little better!
I have heard rumors that the end of the world is near.  One look at that crystal in the center of town, and I am tempted to believe them!

There was a pack of those vile wererats behind my house again last night.  Someone should do something about the vile little creatures. Between those vermin and the dire wolves it amazing that our children are safe!
Please don't hurt us!  Arion Hunter says we are friends now!
Notes: Were-rats in Smugglers Cove after Fellmoon's letter has been delivered (Questbit 4).  Rats in Dungeon should not be hostile after this questbit is set

Text: We will be forever in your debt!  You have saved Ravenshore and all of Jadame!
Would you like to fire the cannons in defense of Dagger Wound Island?
Help us!  If we do not push the pirates off the island all will be lost!
With the Pirate Outpost defeated our homes are once again safe!  Thank you!
Ogres have become more of a problem in our daily lives.  If someone were to deal with the Ogres in their fortress, maybe things would get better!
Warrior Wasps have built a large nest southeast of here.  They could become a threat to the city if the nest grows too large.
News from the different regions of Jadame has been very slow in getting to Alvar.  I wonder if the merchants know what is going on in the world?
The sea of fire has destroyed our village!  Who knows how long we can still live here.
With the destruction of the village, all we need now is a Cyclops raiding party to attack us!  Then our fate would be sealed and we would certainly perish!

A strange cave has opened north of the village.  It appeared shortly after the sea of fire devastated the village.  Strange creatures have been seen entering and leaving this cave.  I wonder what is inside it?
Under Sir Charles Quixote's guidance we will rid this region of the threat of Dragons once and for all!

Nagas have become more and more of a problem while we are hunting.  It's not bad enough that we have to stay watchful for Dragons attacking us from the sky, now we have to worry about Nagas ranging out from their vault.
Sir Charles Quixote sent us out to train under the guidance of Jeric Whistlebone.  Some day I hope to be as great a knight as he!

There have been strange flashes of light from the north for many nights now.  Zanthora the Mad Necromancer is most certainly brewing up trouble for someone.  I certainly hope it is not for us of the Guild of Necromancers!
There was another vampire attack last night.  I wish we didn’t have to put up with them!  But the Guild of Necromancers has their alliance with the Nosferatu, and we cannot retaliate.
There has not been a battle with the Temple of the Sun in years.  I hope they are not planning another assault upon the Guild.  It took years for us to recover from the last battle!
Glory to all who bathe in the cleansing light of the Sun! Do you walk in the path of its light?
There was a tremendous wind storm that devastated most of the forest to the north of here!  It has driven basilisks, will o' wisps and unicorns closer to the temple!
Be gone!  We have no use for you here, unless we uses you to feed the wyverns!
Notes: Ogres in Ravage Roaming by Zog's fort

Text: We have not had any travelers from Balzathar Lair since the canyon filled with water.  I wonder if any of them survived the flood!
Notes: Ogres in Ravage Roaming by boat dock

Text: Better watch out!  The Dread Pirate Stanley doesn't like strangers snooping around our island!
If we can conquer Dagger Wound Island, then nothing will stop us from raiding Ravenshore and even the city of Alvar itself!
I saw torches last night at the old ruined fort across the bay last night.   I wonder what people were doing out there?
Thanks for helping us empty the lair!
Now that the water is gone, we can begin putting our lives in order.  But what if the flood comes back?  Are we still safe?
Our herd leader, Masul, will certainly wish to speak with you if you haven't already found him.  Seek him out and he may reward you for helping us.
Group 36
Group 37
Nothing to see here… move along.
Walk in the Light, friends.
Welcome to our holy retreat. If you have business with our order, seek out the head priest, Oskar Tyre. His office is in the temple.
What are you bothering me for? Talk to the Guildmaster, Sandro. He deals with guests. Not me!
Out of my way, cretin! You interrupt my thoughts, and I'm thinking about important matters!
I hope that this war against the Dragons never ends!  Charles Quixote pays mercenaries like myself very well for our services.
Our king, Deftclaw, has given you his protection, but watch your step. Cause any trouble, and I will make a snack out of you.
Our king, Deftclaw, has given you his protection, but watch your step. Cause any trouble, and I will make a snack out of you.
Group 46
Group 47
Group 48
Group 49

Notes: Used for the non-talkative friendly monsters
